alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:50PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Buchanan County through 315 PM EDT... At 249 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Davenport, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Vansant and Oakwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building until the storm passes. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southwestern Virginia...and southern West Virginia.
